page.title: 03LANGRISH MANOR FARM
page.content: The farm has been owned by the Lambert family for 80 years.They farm cereal crops, cattle for milk and beef, and other protein crops. The EEC quota forced the farm to destroy 20 cattle. Grain sales depend on the Russians as they dominate the grain market. Crops change nearly every year to meet with public demand.The Govern- ment buys any surplus grain from the farm and it can be stored for up to 12 years. The EEC quota reduced the value of a cow from Â£700 to Â£400.The value of a farm can change in a matter of months, so there are subsidies from time to time. If disease spreads, a break crop(cereals etc.) are grown to lower the extent of the disease.In the winter,turnips or grass(eaten by sheep )are grown. 22 people worked on the farm at first, but now only 4 people work there.
